senses.de: When two or more things or people influence each other
senses.ex: There's little interaction between the two colleagues.

Tips.title: Personal Influence
Tips.description: Focus on the personal aspect when people impact each other's thoughts or actions.
Tips.example: Their interaction changed his perspective on the topic.

Tips.title: Subtle Effects
Tips.description: Consider the small but significant ways things or people can affect one another.
Tips.example: The subtle interaction between her calm demeanor and his anxiety was fascinating.

Tips.title: Reciprocal Action
Tips.description: Understand that interaction often implies a two-way or mutual influence.
Tips.example: The players' interaction on the field improved team performance.

senses.de: The communication or direct involvement with someone or something
senses.ex: The museum encourages interaction between the displays and the audience.

Tips.title: Cultural Dimensions
Tips.description: Be aware that the way people interact can be affected by cultural norms and expectations.
Tips.example: Their interaction was polite yet distant, reflective of their cultural backgrounds.

Tips.title: Inclusive Language
Tips.description: Note that interaction should be inclusive and acknowledge all participants.
Tips.example: Their group interaction included everyone's input and ideas.

senses.de: Effect on each other, particularly for things or substances when combined or mixed
senses.ex: The interaction of the drug with alcohol can be dangerous.

Tips.title: Scientific Context
Tips.description: Recognize that in scientific contexts, interactions often refer to physical or chemical processes.
Tips.example: The scientists examined the interaction between the two compounds.

Tips.title: Quantifiable Effects
Tips.description: In scientific study, interactions are usually observed, measured, and quantified.
Tips.example: Research focuses on the quantifiable interaction among variables.

senses.de: The transmission of data between a user and a computer system, especially through a user interface
senses.ex: The design of the application allows for easy interaction.

Tips.title: User Experience
Tips.description: In computing, interaction often relates to how user-friendly and efficient a digital interface is.
Tips.example: He admired the smooth interaction within the new app.

Tips.title: Feedback Loop
Tips.description: Interaction in computing may involve an exchange where the system responds to user actions.
Tips.example: The game's interaction provided real-time feedback to players.

Association.wordDefinition:
Association refers to the relationship between two or more things, where they may be linked in some way but not necessarily interacting with each other directly.

For example, there may be an association between smoking and lung cancer, without any direct interaction between the two.

In simpler terms, association is like a general connection between things, while interaction involves direct engagement or communication between those things.

Collaborate.wordDefinition:
Collaborate means to work together with others to achieve a common goal, while interaction means communicating or working with someone else, even if the goal isn't necessarily the same.

Collaboration implies a shared objective or outcome that all parties are working towards, while interaction can be more casual or spontaneous.

For example, students collaborating on a group project are working together towards a specific grade or assignment. On the other hand, students interacting with each other during class discussion might not be working towards a specific goal, but are still engaging with each other in a learning environment.

In summary, collaboration is more intentional and goal-oriented, while interaction is a broader term that can describe any kind of communication or engagement with others, even if the goal isn't as focused.

Communicate.wordDefinition:
Communication is the act of expressing thoughts, ideas or information to someone else through words, gestures, writing, or other means.

In simpler words, communication is the way we convey a message. It's mostly one-way.

Communication is applicable when we want to convey a message or information to someone else, for example, in writing an email, giving a speech or presentation, or talking on the phone.

Connection.wordDefinition:
Connection refers to the state of being linked or joined together, often in a physical or emotional sense.

It describes the bond or relationship between people, ideas, or things. For example, you might say that you have a connection with your best friend because you share similar interests and values.

Connection describes the relationship between two or more things, while interaction describes the behavior or communication between them.

Contact.wordDefinition:
Contact refers to when two things touch or communicate with each other. For example, if you call someone on the phone, you have made contact with them.

Interaction refers to when two things have a relationship or impact on each other. For example, if you have a conversation with someone on the phone, you are not only making contact with them but also interacting with them.

Contact refers to a physical or verbal connection, while interaction refers to a relationship or effect on each other.

Both words can be used in social situations, but contact is more limited to physical touch or communication, while interaction encompasses a wider range of relationships or exchanges.

Engagement.wordDefinition:
Engagement refers to the level of commitment someone has towards a particular activity or event. It is a measure of how actively involved someone is with the said activity, whether mentally or emotionally.

Engagement can be applicable to anything from work to school to social life.

Engagement measures the level of involvement someone has with an activity, while interaction describes the act of communicating and exchanging information with others.

Intercommunication.wordDefinition:
Intercommunication refers specifically to communication between individuals or different groups. This often involves exchanging information through speech or writing, but can also involve other forms of communication such as body language.

For instance, when a manager communicates with their employees, they are engaging in intercommunication.

Interaction is a broader term that can involve any type of mutual exchange or action, while intercommunication specifically refers to communication between individuals or groups.

Involvement.wordDefinition:
Involvement refers to being a part of something or participating actively in it.

Interaction is more focused on communication while involvement is more focused on active participation. Both words are applicable in different contexts depending on the situation.

Participate.wordDefinition:
Participate refers to the act of taking part or engaging in a particular activity or event. Participation involves active involvement in an activity, which might involve interaction with others or not.

For example, participating in a sport involves actively engaging in the game, following the rules and playing to win.

Interaction involves communication and exchange of ideas between two or more parties, while participation involves actively engaging or taking part in an activity or event.

Relationship.wordDefinition:
Interaction refers to the act of communicating or doing something together, while relationship refers to the way in which two or more people or things are connected or their feelings towards one another.

However, two students who have become close friends have a relationship beyond simple interactions, as they have a emotional connection that extends beyond academic pursuits.

The word interaction describes the action of communication or an event in which people or things act upon each other, while the word relationship describes the more complex and emotional connections between people or things.

quotes.Text: We have a very open culture at the company, where we foster a lot of interaction between not just me and people but between everyone else. It's an open floor plan. People have these desks where no one really has an office. I mean, I have a room where I meet with people. But it has all glass, so everyone can see into it and see what's going on.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.Text: Computers are still technology because we are still wrestling with it: it's still being invented; we're still trying to work out how it works. There's a world of game interaction to come that you or I wouldn't recognise. It's time for the machines to disappear. The computer's got to disappear into all of the things we use.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Douglas Adams

quotes.Text: Most of us yearn for really intimate, healthy, in-person relationships. People have a deep desire to be understood, to be told that it's OK, that you're not isolated and broken, that this is part of the human challenge, and that there is hope. The capacity for online interactions to do that is powerful.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Ze Frank

quotes.Text: I think sometimes people can get lost in the bigger special effects, science fiction, robot stuff, and those are cool and fun to watch, too, but I think it's so important to sometimes step back and watch something that's about life and human interaction.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Dakota Fanning

quotes.Text: I love children and I love family and I love that interaction. Because I had a really close relationship with my mother, I understand that deep powerful love, and it's so beautiful. To be a mother to a child is the most brilliant gift; it's gorgeous.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Alicia Keys

quotes.Text: There are interactions with characters within the game which I think are pretty neatly done considering the limitations that you have to work with. I mean, a computer can't really generate a character that talks back and forth with you successfully.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Fred Saberhagen

quotes.Text: It's nice to be able to look at one protein, but life is driven by the interactions between proteins, so it's really essential to be able to see multiple proteins at a time to understand these interactions.
quotes.Title: American Physicist
quotes.Name: Eric Betzig

quotes.Text: It's okay to take time for yourself. We give so much of ourselves to others and we need to be fueled both physically and mentally. If we are in balance, it helps us in all our interactions.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Faith Hill

quotes.Text: I do think there must be some kind of interaction between your living life and the life that goes on from here.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actor
quotes.Name: Keanu Reeves

quotes.Text: Ultimately, life is a chemical interaction.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Heidi Hammel
